main event: A silver, half-dollar sized object with flashing lights was observed hovering and then disappearing in Fayetteville, North Carolina on October 8, 1960.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be one of the new Lear Jet experimental models being tested in the area.
The object appeared to be hovering and then just disappeared.
The observer was an electrical engineer from Fayetteville, North Carolina, employed by Carolina Power & Light Co.
Another observer, a college student, also got a clear view of the object.
The USAF AFIT was flying in the local area at the time, but their altitude and direction were unknown.
sighted object: silver, half-dollar sized object with flashing lights
